meanings.definition: Match or surpass (a person or achievement), typically by imitation.
meanings.sent1: She was emulating her favorite singer by copying her dance moves.
meanings.sent2: The young artist was emulating the style of the famous painter in her latest artwork.
meanings.sent3: The little boy was emulating his dad by wearing a tie and pretending to go to work.
meanings.sent4: The student was emulating the teacher's calm demeanor during the presentation.
meanings.sent5: The athlete was emulating the world record holder's technique to improve his own performance.

meanings.definition: Imitate the function of (a different system), typically by using a software system or program.
meanings.sent1: The new computer program is emulating the behavior of the old system.
meanings.sent2: The virtual assistant is emulating human speech patterns to interact with users.
meanings.sent3: The robot was emulating a vacuum cleaner by moving around the room and making buzzing noises.
meanings.sent4: The emulator software is emulating the functions of the gaming console to run old games.
meanings.sent5: The AI technology is emulating the decision-making process of expert doctors in diagnosing diseases.

meanings.sent1: The students were emulating each other in the spelling bee competition.
meanings.sent2: The young gymnast was emulating the older athletes in her dedication to training.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were emulating each other in trying to jump higher on the trampoline.
meanings.sent4: The team was emulating the champions' strategy to improve their chances of winning.
meanings.sent5: The chef was emulating the famous recipe to recreate the delicious dish for her restaurant.
